dialogues.text: Who do you think they are to each
Yeah, this is a hard one.
I think the white guy and the asian girl are a couple, and the asian guy is her brother.
Or is it the asian girl and the asian guy are a couple, and the white guy is their American friend?
I don't know, they're not really talking to the white guy.
Maybe they're tourists and the white guy is their tour guide?
I guess that doesn't make sense.

scenes.heading: INT. HAE SUNG'S FAMILY APARTMENT ‑ SEOUL ‑ MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Hae Sung unlocks the automatic door (most doors in Korea are locked with a password) to his home. He stumbles in as quietly as he can manage in his inebriated state, trying not to wake up his parents with whom he lives.

scenes.heading: EXT. MONTAUK RESIDENCY BARN HOUSE ‑ DAY
scenes.actionPreview: In Montauk, New York, Nora arrives at the artist residency in a cab. This is where she will stay for a month.

scenes.heading: INT. MONTAUK RESIDENCY BARN HOUSE ‑ DOWNSTAIRS ‑ DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Nora enters the building and looks around. The house is rustic but absolutely charming, with beautiful art on the walls and filled to the brim with books ‑‑ but no one is there. She walks upstairs in search of an unoccupied room.

scenes.heading: INT. MONTAUK RESIDENCY BARN HOUSE ‑ UPSTAIRS ‑ CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: On the second floor, the first bedroom she sees is occupied with suitcases. She continues down the hallway and finds two unoccupied bedrooms directly across from each other. She looks at both꞉ one is obviously nicer. She walks into that one.

scenes.heading: INT. BARN HOUSE ‑ NORA'S ROOM ‑ CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: There is a bed, a fan, and a large wooden desk. On the wall, the previous artist residents of the room have written their names and the year they occupied it. Nora walks up to the wall, finds an empty spot on the wall, and adds her name to it꞉ Nora Moon . There are spider webs and dust in the corner

scenes.actionPreview: Late at night, the Dumbo pier is impossibly beautiful in a different way. Manhattan lights up brightly. It's the most romantic place in the world. It is not as populated as when Hae Sung and Nora left it, but there are some straggling lovers staying out all night and making out.
